content: Do we have the "polynomial" product of finsupps? That is, given f g : α →₀ β, the finsupp f * g : α →₀ β should be the sum of single (i + j) (f i * g j) over i ∈ support f and j ∈ support g.
Is that not docs#Polynomial ?
It would be, except my types are really weird! I want to multiply finsupps Ordinal →₀ NatOrdinal
This is needed in order to characterize the Cantor normal form of the natural product, which is precisely this operation applies to the Cantor normal form of the inputs
Isn't docs#NatOrdinal a semiring?
Oh, you're right
For a moment I thought polynomials needed to be defined in terms of rings
In fact, I think what I want is the product in AddMonoidAlgebra NatOrdinal Ordinal
That's what I was writing :grinning:
Thanks!

Actually, there's an issue! I actually want to multiply finsupps NatOrdinal →₀ Ordinal, and I can't do this since ordinals don't form a semiring.

technically my maps are NatOrdinal →₀ ℕ, but I can't make any nice transfer function. The argument goes "the ordinals in question are less than ω, so there exists some natural equal to them, and we use choice to retrieve it"

The product on AddMonoidAlgebra k G should be able to be sensibly defined even if nothing is known about the product on k, right? That's not to say it's very useful in those cases, though it would be for me.
...actually, Finsupp.sum can't be sensibly defined if the codomain isn't at least commutative under addition
which ordinals aren't
So I guess I'll have to cast everything to NatOrdinal →₀ ℕ first
Violeta Hernández has marked this topic as resolved.
You can define Ordinal.toNat (if it isn't defined yet), and use 0 for all infinite ordinals.
